content.raw:
One thing I noticed is that this PR seems to change the camera position and width for the unstructured mesh examples here: https://tests.yt-project.org/job/yt_docs/658/artifact/sandbox/doc/build/html/visualizing/unstructured_mesh_rendering.html

With this PR, sometimes the Camera is very away, and sometimes it's inside the mesh. Before, the looked this: http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/visualizing/unstructured_mesh_rendering.html

description:
This makes it much more natural to manipulate units for volume rendering parameters - particularly for camera parameters.

For example, one can now do:

`camera.width = 1.0`

And it will automagically convert that into a 3-element YTArray, interpreting it as using normalized units.

For now I've settled on using "unitary" units (i.e. 1.0 corresponds to ds.domain_width.max()) internally in the camera infrastructure. I could also use `code_length`, but that's ambiguous for e.g. cosmological time series dataset.

This PR includes the `Camera` API change I mentioned on the mailing list.
